chunk_00001.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Street corner newsstand — daytime, bright natural light

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Phoebe Buffay: dark-colored coat - dark pants - long, wavy blonde hair - animated
Rachel Green: dark leather jacket - dark pants - dark hair in a beanie - surprised expression

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Phoebe and Rachel stand at a newsstand, talking and gesturing animatedly. Phoebe points behind Rachel, who turns to look. They both react with exaggerated surprise as an ambulance drives past, causing them to jump back and gesture in shock. The scene cuts to the Friends cast in their apartment, where they are seated and laughing together.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Newsstand with newspapers and magazines (various covers visible)
- Ambulance (orange and white, with "AMBULANCE" written on front)
- Street with snow patches and parked cars
- Brick buildings with windows and posters

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Phoebe discusses checking the horoscope with Rachel. The conversation has a casual, joking tone, with Phoebe appearing animated and Rachel reacting with surprise. The sudden appearance of the ambulance adds a comedic element to their interaction.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
- Scene transitions from street to apartment interior
- Phoebe and Rachel move from standing at the newsstand to reacting to the ambulance
- Characters in apartment transition from seated to laughing together
chunk_00001.subtitles: Do you think they have yesterday's Daily News? MONICA: Why? - I just wanna check my horoscope... ...see if it was right. Oh, my God. Phoebe. Don't look now, but, behind you there's a guy... ...who has the potential to break our hearts and plunge us into depression. Where? Ooh, come to Mama. Okay, he's coming. Be cool. Be cool. Be cool. - Nice hat. BOTH: Thanks. - We should do something. Whistle. - We're not gonna whistle. - Yeah, come on, do it. - No. - Do it. Do it. Do it. - Woo-hoo! [AMBULANCE SIRENS WAILING] [TIRES SQUEALING THEN THUD] I can't believe you did that.

chunk_00002.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Hospital room — nighttime, artificial lighting from lamps and medical equipment.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Phoebe Buffay: dark-colored top - unclear lower clothing - long, wavy blonde hair - concerned expression
Rachel Green: black leather jacket - unclear lower clothing - dark, shoulder-length hair - serious expression
Unidentified person (in bed): hospital gown - unclear hair color - sleeping

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Phoebe and Rachel stand by the hospital bed, looking down at the sleeping person. Phoebe leans forward, placing her hand on the person's chest, appearing concerned. Rachel stands beside her, looking down with a serious expression. The person in bed remains still and asleep throughout the scene.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Hospital bed: with blue blanket and pillows
- Medical equipment: monitor and IV stand (visible near bed)
- Lamp: white base, on bedside table
- Curtains: beige, partially drawn

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Phoebe discusses the sleeping person's condition with Rachel. The conversation has a concerned tone, with Phoebe appearing worried and Rachel reacting with seriousness. The dialogue mentions the person's face and suggests they might be a lawyer.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
None observed.
chunk_00002.subtitles: MONICA: Why did I woo-hoo? I mean, what was I hoping? He'd turn around and say: "Ooh, I love that sound. I must have you now"? I just wish there was something we could do. [EKG BEEPING] Hello. Hello, coma guy. Get up, you Girl Scout! Up, up, up! - Phoebe, what are you doing? - Maybe nobody's tried this. I wish we at least knew his name. Would you look at that face? I mean, even sleeping he looks smart. I bet he's a lawyer.

chunk_00003.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Hospital room — daytime, clinical fluorescent lighting. The scene transitions to the friends' apartment — evening, warm ambient lighting from lamps and windows.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Phoebe Buffay: light-colored patterned vest over striped shirt - dark pants - long, curly blonde hair - expression shifts from concerned to smiling
Rachel Green: dark-colored top - dark pants - dark, shoulder-length hair - expression shifts from concerned to smiling, then to serious
Chandler Bing: dark-colored shirt - dark pants - short, brown hair - expression: relaxed, smiling
Joey Tribbiani: red sweater - dark pants - medium-length brown hair - expression: smiling, relaxed
Ross Geller: dark-colored shirt - dark pants - short, brown hair - expression: serious, concerned
Monica Geller: dark-colored sweater - dark pants - dark, shoulder-length hair - expression: animated, concerned

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Phoebe and Rachel stand by a hospital bed, talking and gesturing toward a patient. Phoebe leans on Rachel’s shoulder comfortingly. The scene cuts to the friends’ apartment, where Phoebe and Rachel stand near the kitchen counter, talking with Chandler, Joey, Ross, and Monica. Monica holds a bag of chips, while Chandler and Joey sit on the couch, smiling and talking. Ross sits nearby, looking concerned. Rachel sits in a chair, holding a mug. The group watches TV, where a man on screen holds up a book titled "Euphoria Unbound."

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Hospital bed: blue sheets, medical equipment (IV stand, monitor)
- Coffee mugs: various colors (on table)
- Wooden coffee table (center)
- TV: black, displaying a talk show host holding a book
- Book: "Euphoria Unbound" (on TV screen)
- Brick wall decor (background)
- Patterned couch (center)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Phoebe and Rachel discuss a man they met, speculating he’s a lawyer who teaches sculpting and can dance. The conversation has a joking, lighthearted tone, with Phoebe animatedly speaking and Rachel smiling. The group in the apartment watches TV, reacting to the talk show host discussing the book "Euphoria Unbound."

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Scene transitions from hospital room to friends’ apartment.
Phoebe leans on Rachel’s shoulder.
Chandler and Joey sit on the couch.
Ross sits nearby, looking concerned.
Rachel sits in a chair, holding a mug.
The group watches TV, where a man on screen holds up a book.
chunk_00003.subtitles: I mean, even sleeping he looks smart. I bet he's a lawyer. Yeah, but did you see the dents in his knuckles? That means he's artistic. Okay. He's a lawyer who teaches sculpting on the side. And he can dance. And he's the kind of guy who, when you're talking, he's listening... ...you know, and not saying, "Yeah, I understand"... ...but wondering what you look like naked. - Oh, stop it. I wish all guys could be like him. I know. Are there no conscious men in the city for you two? - He doesn't have anyone. - Yeah. We feel kind of responsible. I can't believe you said, "Woo-hoo." I don't even say, "Woo-hoo." Oh, she's coming up. She's coming up. Folks, when we come back... ...we'll talk about her new book Euphoria Unbound... ...with always-interesting Nora Tyler Bing. Put the kids to bed for this one. Don't watch this. Weekend at Bernie's is on Showtime and HBO and Cinemex.

chunk_00004.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
The Friends apartment living room — evening, warm ambient lighting with lamps and decorative wall sconces.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**

Ross Geller: dark blue fleece jacket - light-colored pants - dark, short hair - concerned
Chandler Bing: dark patterned zip-up shirt - dark pants - dark, wavy hair - expressive
Rachel Green: black top - black pants - dark, shoulder-length hair - smiling
Phoebe Buffay: striped shirt - dark overalls - long, blonde hair - animated
Joey Tribbiani: red sweater - dark pants - dark, wavy hair - relaxed

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
The group is gathered in the living room, seated on couches and chairs, watching television. Chandler stands and gestures animatedly while talking, then walks toward the kitchen area. Rachel and Monica sit on the couch, with Monica holding a bag of chips and talking to Ross, who gestures back. Phoebe stands near the kitchen counter, holding a bowl. Joey sits on the couch, eating chips. The group reacts to something on TV, with Chandler and Phoebe pointing at the screen.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Coffee mugs: various colors (on table)
- Wooden coffee table (center)
- Blue kitchen cabinets (background)
- Refrigerator with magnets (kitchen area)
- Television (on stand, showing a talk show)
- Bowl of chips (held by Phoebe)
- Bag of chips (held by Monica)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Chandler discusses his mother's books with the group, expressing excitement about them. The conversation has a casual, joking tone, with Chandler appearing animated and the others reacting with smiles and nods. The group is engaged in the discussion, with Ross and Monica actively participating.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Chandler stands up and walks toward the kitchen area
Phoebe moves from the kitchen counter to stand near the refrigerator
Rachel and Monica remain seated on the couch throughout
Joey remains seated on the couch, eating chips
The group shifts attention to the television screen
chunk_00004.subtitles: Don't watch this. Weekend at Bernie's is on Showtime and HBO and Cinemex. - No way. - Come on. She's your mom. Exactly. Weekend at Bernie's. Dead guy getting hit in the groin 20, 30 times. - No? - Chandler, I gotta tell you... ...I love your mom's books. I love her books. I cannot get on a plane without one. I mean, this is so cool. You wouldn't think it's cool if you were 11... ...and all your friends were passing around page 79 of Mistress Bitch. Come on, Chandler. I love your mom. I think she's a blast. - You can say that. She's not your mom. ROSS: Oh, please. She's the... RACHEL: Hi, sweetie. When did Rigatoni get back from Rome? - Last night. - Really? So then his plane didn't explode in a big ball of fire? Just a dream I had. But, phew. Hey, hey, hey. She's on. Ah. Nora Bing. Before we get to the book. What is this about you being arrested in London? What is that about?

Monica and Rachel are seated on the couch, engaged in conversation with each other and the group. Joey sits on the couch, smiling and listening. Ross sits beside Monica, attentive. chunk_00005.subtitles: What is this about you being arrested in London? What is that about? - Your mom was arrested? - Shh, I'm busy beaming with pride. This is kind of embarrassing... ...but occasionally after I've been intimate with a man... - Why would she say that's embarrassing? - Shh. - I just get this craving for Kung Pao chicken. That's too much information. So now you're doing this book tour thing. How's that going? Oh, fine. I'm leaving for New York tomorrow, which I hate. But I get to see my son, who I love. GROUP: Oh. This is the way that I find out. Most moms use the phone. You know, don't take this wrong, I just don't see you as a mom somehow. - I don't mean that bad. - Oh, no. I'm a fabulous mom. I bought my son his first condoms. And then he burst into flames.

chunk_00006.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Hospital room — daytime, bright artificial lighting
The setting is a hospital room with medical equipment, a bed, and a door leading to a hallway. A large potted plant is visible near the door.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Monica Geller: dark-colored sweater - jeans - dark, shoulder-length hair - concerned expression
Rachel Green: dark-colored top - dark pants - long, blonde hair - smiling expression
Chandler Bing: hospital gown - blanket - brown, medium-length hair - sleeping expression
Phoebe Buffay: patterned top - dark pants - long, blonde hair - focused expression
Joey Tribbiani: hospital gown - blanket - brown, medium-length hair - sleeping expression

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Monica and Rachel are visiting Chandler Bing in his hospital bed, where he is sleeping. Rachel places a blanket over Chandler, then sits beside him. Phoebe enters the room holding a large bouquet of flowers and places them on the bedside table. Monica then applies shaving cream to Chandler’s face while Phoebe watches. Chandler remains asleep throughout the scene.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Hospital bed: with blue pillow and patterned blanket
- Medical monitor: displaying EKG readings
- Bouquet of flowers: red, white, and purple (on bedside table)
- Potted plant: large, green (near door)
- Lamp: white shade (on bedside table)
- Bag: white with "Addies" text (on floor near bed)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Monica discusses current events with the group, mentioning Congress and subway fares. The conversation has a casual tone, with Monica appearing animated and the others listening attentively. Phoebe interjects with a joke about names, suggesting "Agamemnon" as a name for someone, which Monica dismisses as too special.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
- Phoebe enters the room from the hallway
- Monica applies shaving cream to Chandler’s face
- Rachel places a blanket over Chandler
- Phoebe places flowers on the bedside table
chunk_00006.subtitles: And then he burst into flames. [EKG BEEPING] MONICA: Let's see. "Congress is debating a new deficit-reduction bill. The mayor wants to raise subway fares again. The high today was 45." And, oh. And teams played sports. [INAUDIBLE DIALOGUE] PHOEBE: What about Glen? MONICA: No. - He could be a Glen. - Mm-mm. Not special enough. Ooh, how about Agamemnon? Way too special.

chunk_00007.subtitles: I'm famished. What do I want? Please, God, don't let it be Kung Pao chicken. Oh, you watched the show. What did you think? Well, I think you need to come out of your shell just... What is this dive? - Only you could've picked this place. - Oh. Come on. Shut up. It's fun. - Hi. NORA: Give me a hug. - Well, I think we're ready for some tequila. - I know I am. - Who's doing shots? - Hit me. - I'm in. - There you go. Ross? Uh, I'm not really a shot-drinking kind of guy. Hi. Sorry. Sorry we're late. We, uh, kind of just, you know, lost track of time. But a man can change. Anyone want me to appraise anything?

chunk_00008.subtitles: Mrs. Bing, I have to tell you, I've read everything you've ever written. No, I mean it. When I read Euphoria at Midnight... ...all I wanted to do was become a writer. Oh, please, honey. If I can do it, anybody can. You just start with half a dozen European cities... ...throw in 30 euphemisms for male genitalia... ...and, bam, you have got yourself a book. My mother, ladies and gentlemen. Yeah, any messages for room 226? - You okay, slugger? - Oh, yeah. I'm fine. I'm fine. What is with you tonight? Nothing. Nothing, nothing, nothing.

chunk_00009.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
A dimly lit hallway or lobby area, likely inside a restaurant or bar, with warm, artificial lighting. Wooden doors and vintage-style posters on the walls are visible.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Ross Geller: dark suit jacket - dark pants - dark, short hair - expression shifts from surprised to serious and engaged
Unidentified person: dark-colored top - blonde, shoulder-length hair - expression animated and expressive

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Ross Geller stands facing an unidentified woman with blonde hair, who is gesturing animatedly while speaking. Ross listens intently, his expression changing as she talks, occasionally looking down or to the side. The woman moves closer to him as she speaks, maintaining eye contact and using hand gestures to emphasize her points.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Wall-mounted payphone (black, on right wall)
- Wooden doors with signs (one reads "CHICOS")
- Vintage posters on walls (one features a rodeo scene)
- Stacked magazines or papers on a low surface (bottom right)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
The unidentified woman discusses writing and book sales with Ross Geller, referencing a character named "Paolo" and contrasting him with a "hero" on a book cover. The conversation has a casual, slightly humorous tone, with the woman appearing animated and Ross listening seriously, occasionally reacting with surprise or contemplation.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
The unidentified woman moves from standing near the payphone to standing directly in front of Ross Geller as she speaks. Ross shifts his position slightly, turning to face her more directly as the conversation progresses.
chunk_00009.subtitles: NORA: Okay, thank you. It's the Italian hand-licker, isn't it? No. It's the one he's licking. She's supposed to be with you. You're good. Oh, Ross, listen to me. I have sold 100 million copies of my books... ...and you know why? The girl on the cover with her nipples showing? No, because I know how to write men that women fall in love with. Believe me, I cannot sell a Paolo. People will not turn 325 pages for a Paolo. Come on. The guy's a secondary character. He's just a... You know, a complication you eventually kill off. When? He's not a hero. You know who our hero is? The guy on the cover with his nipples showing? No, it's you. - Please. - No, really.

Ross Geller discusses a recent kiss with the unidentified woman, suggesting they don't need to tell Chandler about it. The conversation has a tense, awkward tone, with Ross appearing flustered and the unidentified woman looking concerned. The unidentified woman reacts by walking away after the kiss.

chunk_00010.subtitles: - Please. - No, really. Come on. You're smart. You're sexy. - Right. - Oh, come on, kiddo. You're gonna be fine, believe me. Uh-oh. Uh, I'll just pee in the street. [KNOCKING ON DOOR] Is Chandler here? - Yeah. - Wait. Come here. Okay, uh, about last night... ...um, you know... ...Chandler. You didn't tell... Okay, I'm thinking we don't need to tell Chandler. It was just a kiss. One kiss. No big deal, right? - Right. No big deal. - Okay. In Bizarro-world.

chunk_00011.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
The hallway outside apartment 200 — daytime, warm artificial lighting

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Ross Geller: dark suit jacket - light blue shirt - dark tie - dark, short hair - serious, concerned expression
Chandler Bing: striped robe over white t-shirt - dark pants - brown, medium-length hair - animated, expressive expression
Joey Tribbiani: blue t-shirt - dark pants - brown, medium-length hair - surprised, concerned expression

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Ross and Chandler stand in the hallway, engaged in an animated conversation. Chandler gestures with his hands while speaking, and Ross responds with hand gestures and facial expressions. Joey enters from the apartment doorway holding a newspaper, joins the conversation, and then walks away. Chandler crosses his arms and listens to Ross, who appears to be explaining something with a serious expression.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Newspaper: white, held by Joey (in hand)
- Door: green, with number 200 visible
- Radiator: silver, visible against wall
- Kitchen area: visible through doorway, with white stove and cabinets

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross discusses a social faux pas with Chandler, specifically about not kissing a friend's mom, while Joey enters and reacts to the conversation. The tone is casual and slightly humorous, with Ross appearing serious and Chandler animated. Joey reacts with surprise and concern as he enters the scene.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Joey enters the frame from the apartment doorway
Joey walks away from the group after entering
Ross and Chandler continue their conversation while standing in the hallway
chunk_00011.subtitles: You broke the code. - What code? - You don't kiss your friend's mom. Sisters are okay. Maybe a hot-looking aunt. But not a mom. Never a mom. [ALL SHOUTING] What are you guys doing out here? Uh, well, Joey and I had discussed getting in an early morning racquetball game. But, um, apparently somebody overslept. Yeah, well, you don't have your racquet. No. No, I don't, because it's being restrung. Ahem. Somebody was supposed to bring me one. Yeah. Well, you didn't call and leave your grip size. Okay, you guys are spending way too much time together. Okay, I'm scum. I'm scum. - Ross, how could you let this happen? - I don't know. Well, it's not like she's a regular mom. You know? She's sexy. She's... You don't think my mom's sexy? Well, not in the same way.

chunk_00012.subtitles: Well, not in the same way. I'll have you know that Gloria Tribbiani... ...was a handsome woman in her day, all right? You think it's easy giving birth to seven children? Huh? Okay, I think we're getting into a weird area here. - Aah. - Hey. - Hey. - What are you guys doing out here? Well, ha, ha, not playing racquetball. - He forgot to leave his grip size. - He didn't get the goggles. Oh. Right. Well, sounds like you two have issues. Goodbye, baby. [SPEAKING IN ITALIAN] Do they wait for me to do this? - So are you gonna tell him? - I'm not gonna tell him. - Why would I tell him? - How about, because if you don't... ...his mother might? - Hmm. What are you guys doing here? Uh, he's not even wearing a jock strap.

The two women converse, with Phoebe appearing animated and Rachel listening, then speaking with a serious expression. The patient remains still in bed throughout.

chunk_00013.subtitles: Uh, he's not even wearing a jock strap. What did I ask? [EKG BEEPING] - Hi. - Hi. What are you doing here? Nothing. I just thought I'd stop by, you know, after the, ahem... That I, you know. Um, so, what are you doing here? I'm not really here. I just thought I'd drop these off on the way. My way. Do you, um, come here a lot... ...without me? No, no, no. So, um, do you think he's doing any better than he was this morning? How would I know? I wasn't here.

chunk_00014.subtitles: How would I know? I wasn't here. Really? Not even to, um, change his pajamas? Oh, my God. You're my friend. I had to tell you. I can't believe it. Paolo kissed my mom? Yeah, I mean, I don't know if you noticed, but he had a lot to drink. I mean, you know how he gets when he's drunk... I can't do this. I did it. It was me. I'm sorry. I kissed your mom. What? I was really upset about Rachel and Paolo and I think I had too much tequila... ...and Nora... Mrs. Mom, your Bing, was... She was just being nice, you know? But nothing happened. Nothing. Ask Joey. Joey came in... - You knew about this? - Uh... You know, knowledge is a tricky thing. I spent the entire day with you. Why didn't you tell me? Hey, hey. You're lucky I caught them when I did... ...or else who knows what would've happened? Thanks, man. Big help.

chunk_00015.subtitles: I can't believe this. What the hell were you thinking? I wasn't. I don't know. I... Of all my friends, no one knows the crap I go through with my mom more than you. - I know. - I can't believe you did this. - Me neither. - I'm mad at you for not telling me. - What are you mad at me...? - Let me slam the door. Chandler, I didn't kiss her. He did. See what happens when you break the code? - Joey. - Aah! Uh. - Rach. - Hey. "A Woman Undone. By Rachel Karen Green." Yeah, I thought I'd give it a shot. I'm still on the first chapter. Now, do you think his "love stick" can be "liberated from its denim prison"? Yeah, I'd say so. And there's no "J" in "engorged." - Hey, Rach. - Hey. - Hello. - Hello. - You going to the hospital tonight? - No. You?

chunk_00016.subtitles: - You going to the hospital tonight? - No. You? No. You? You just asked me. Okay, maybe it was a trick question. - Um, Rachel, can we do this now? - Okay. I am so hot. And here's a picture of my mother and father on their wedding day. Now, you tell me she's not a knockout. I cannot believe we're having this conversation. Come on, just try to picture her not pregnant. That's all. Central Perk is proud to present Miss Phoebe Buffay. [CROWD CHEERING] PHOEBE: Thanks. Hi. Um, ahem. Okay. I'd like to start with a song that's about a man I recently met... ...who's, um, come to be very important to me. Okay. [SINGING] You don't have to be awake To be my man

chunk_00017.subtitles: [SINGING] You don't have to be awake To be my man Long as you have brain waves I'll be there to hold your hand Though we just met the other day There's something I have got to say Okay, thank you very much. I'm gonna take a short break. RACHEL: Okay, that was Phoebe Buffay, everybody. Whoo! - What the hell was that? - Phoebe just started... I believe I was talking to Joey. All right, there, mother-kisser? [LAUGHING] "Mother-kisser." I'll shut up. Chandler, can I say something? I know you're still mad at me. I just wanna say that there were two people there that night, okay? - There were two sets of lips. - Yes, well, I expect this from her. Okay? She's always been a Freudian nightmare. Okay, but if she always behaves like this, why don't you say something? Because it's complicated. It's complex.

chunk_00018.subtitles: Because it's complicated. It's complex. Hey, you kissed my mom. We're rehearsing a Greek play. - That's funny. We done now? - No. Okay, you mean you're not gonna talk to her, tell her how you feel? That would be a no. Just because you played tonsil tennis with my mom... ...doesn't mean you know her, all right? Trust me, you can't talk to her. Okay. "You can't"? Or you can't? Okay, that's my finger. Okay, that's my knee. Still doing the play. [SHOUTS THEN HUMS] All right, what did you do with him? [TOILET FLUSHES] - You're awake. - Look at you. How do you feel? Uh, a little woozy, but basically okay. Gosh, you look good. I feel good. Who are you?

The unidentified person listens, then responds while looking at them. The conversation has a slightly sarcastic and disappointed tone, as Monica expresses frustration that their efforts were not reciprocated with a meaningful goodbye. The unidentified person appears grateful but offers a vague farewell, which Monica finds unsatisfactory.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
The unidentified person sits up in the bed and begins speaking after the initial greeting. Monica and Phoebe shift their positions slightly while talking, but remain near the bed throughout the clip.
chunk_00019.subtitles: - Sorry. - I'm Phoebe Buffay. I'm Monica Geller. I've been taking care of you. We both have. - So the Etch A Sketch is from you guys? - Actually, it's just from me. - Yeah, I got you the foot massager. - Know who shaved you? That was me. - I read to you. - I sang. Ha. Well, thanks. - Oh, my pleasure. - You're welcome. So I guess I'll see you around. What? That's it? "See you around"? - Well, what do you want me to say? - Well, I don't know. Maybe, uh: "That was nice. It meant something to me. I'll call you." - All right. I'll call you. - I don't think you mean that. This is so typical. You know, we give... ...and we give... ...and we give. And then we just get nothing back. And then one day, it's just, you know, you wake up and "See you around."

chunk_00020.subtitles: And then one day, it's just, you know, you wake up and "See you around." Let's go, Phoebe. You know what? We thought you were different. But I guess it was just the coma. NORA: The car's running downstairs. I wanted to drop off these copies of my book for your friends. - Anything you want from Lisbon? - No, just knowing you're there is enough. All right. Well, be good. I love you. You kissed my best Ross. Or something to that effect. Okay. Look, it was stupid. - Really stupid. - Really stupid. And I don't even know how it happened. I'm sorry, honey. I promise it will never happen again.

chunk_00021.subtitles: - Are we okay now? - Yeah. No. No. Ah, the forbidden love of a man and his door. Shh. He did it. He told her off. And not just about the kiss, about everything. - You're kidding? - No. He said, "When are you gonna grow up and start being a mom?" - Wow. - Wait, then she came back with: "The question is, when are you gonna grow up and realize I have a bomb?" Okay, wait. Are you sure she didn't say: "When are you gonna grow up and realize I am your mom?" - That makes more sense. - You think? Yeah. So, what's going on now? I don't know. I've been standing here spelling it out for you. I don't hear anything. Wait, wait, wait. What do you see? It's hard to tell. They're so tiny and upside down. Wait, wait, wait. They're walking away. They're walking away.

chunk_00022.subtitles: They're walking away. They're walking away. No, they're not. They're coming right at us. Run, run! You okay, kiddo? - Yeah, I'm okay. - All right. You be good. Drive safe. [CHUCKLES] - Mrs. Bing. - Mr. Geller. Hey. You mean that? Yeah, why not? - So I told her. - Oh. - How did it go? - Awful. Awful. Couldn't have gone worse. - Well, how do you feel? - Pretty good. I told her. Well, see? So maybe it wasn't such a bad idea, you know, me kissing your mom, huh? But we don't have to go down that road.

chunk_00023.subtitles: Now, this is just the first chapter... ...and I want your absolute honest opinion. Okay? Oh, and on page two, he's not reaching for her "heaving beasts." What's a "niffle"? You can usually find them on the heaving beasts. All right, all right, so I'm not a great typist. Wait, did you get to the part about his "huge, throbbing pens"? Tell you, you don't wanna be around when he starts writing with those. - All right, that's it. Give them back. GROUP: No.
